name: André Rossi
content: André Rossi - Computer Scientist - Paris, France André Rossi Short résumé Research Publications Teaching Miscellaneous André Rossi Office P628 LAMSADE UMR CNRS 7243 Université Paris Dauphine - PSL Place du Maréchal de Lattre de Tassigny 75775 Paris Cedex 16 FRANCE andre.rossi 'at' dauphine.psl.eu Short résumé I hold an engineering degree in Automatic Control and Production Science from ENSIEG, INPG, a Master of Science in the same field and a PhD degree in Robust Scheduling. I defended an Habilitation à diriger des recherches in 2012, on networks design and optimization. I am full professor of Computer Science at LAMSADE, Université Paris Dauphine - PSL, France, since 2018. I am currently co-head of MIDO, the Mathematics and Computer Science department of Université Paris Dauphine - PSL. Before that, I was full professor of Operations Research at the Computer Science Department of Université d'Angers, France, from 2015 to 2018. Previously, I was Associate Professor at Université de Bretagne-Sud in Lorient, France, from 2005 to 2015 and served as an invited professor in the Department of Computer and Information Sciences in University of Hyderabad, India, in 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2014. Research Overview My main scientific interests are in Operations research, with a special focus on networks design, and optimization under uncertainty. I am currently involved in the development of hybrid algorithms that combine metaheuristics with exact approaches, and in the design of survivable, resilient and robust solutions, that implement different strategies to cope with uncertainty. Research groups I am a member of the French OR society ROADEF, and former project leader for GT-"Optimisation pour les Systèmes Intégrés", funded by GDR RO, CNRS. Doctoral supervision I supervise the PhD thesis of Louis Kurdyk with Sonia Toubaline on network design under uncertainy, since Fall 2024. My former PhD students are: Dr. Aïssam Belabbas (2004-2007), Dr. María Soto (2008-2011), Dr. Boureima Zerbo (2008-2012), Dr. Alain Bignon (2009-2012), Dr. Fabián Castaño (2011-2014), Dr. Charly Lersteau (2013-2016), Dr. Erwan Moréac (2014-2017), Dr. Aleksandr Pirogov (2016-2019), Dr. Florian Delavernhe (2017-2020), and Dr. Julien Khamphousone (2020-2023).
